NE@SEA.notes: Super Bowl LX at Caesars Superdome, New Orleans. NE beat DEN 24-17 in AFC Championship - Drake Maye outdueled Jarrett Stidham, Rhamondre Stevenson dominant. SEA beat LAR 27-24 in NFC Championship - Jaxon Smith-Njigba 9/142/1, defense held Stafford in check. First Super Bowl meeting between franchises. Patriots seeking 7th Super Bowl title, Seahawks seeking 2nd. Drake Maye: led NFL in QBR, 4th in rushing yards among QBs (450), elite under pressure. Sam Darnold: PFF #4 QB when not pressured, oblique fully healed. Seattle defense elite: league-low 6.0 YPA allowed, 4th-lowest passer rating (77.9), #1 defensive success rate vs designed runs, 3.7 YPC allowed (best in NFL). NE defense: 30 pressures vs LAC in Divisional, dominant in playoffs. Key skill players - NE: Stevenson, DeMario Douglas, Kayshon Boutte, Hunter Henry. SEA: Kenneth Walker III, JSN, Tyler Lockett, AJ Barner. Neutral site dome eliminates weather factor.

writeups.perspective: Subjective game script perspective (not ground truth).

blocks.text: Seattle's defense held six of last eight opponents to 16 or fewer points; NE defense generated 30 pressures vs LAC and confused Herbert's reads.
Expect low-scoring defensive battle. Both teams will try to establish the run early - Stevenson vs Walker/Charbonnet. Dome environment neutralizes weather.
Seattle allowed 8th-fewest WR catches and 2nd-fewest WR yards - tough draw for Boutte/Douglas. NE secondary will be tested by JSN who torched LAR for 9/142/1.
Rhamondre Stevenson out-snapped Henderson 80-51 in playoffs, 6.3 to 2.6 YPT advantage, zero fumbles since Week 5. Volume king for NE.
JSN is the X-factor - 9/142/1 vs LAR, 6/84 and 9/124 vs SF regular season. NE must contain him to win.
Hunter Henry vs SEA TE coverage - Seattle allowed 5th-most TE receptions (105), 6th-most TE yards (1,080). Primary NE passing target.
Kenneth Walker vs NE run D - Patriots held LAC to 2.5 YPC, but Walker has elite missed tackle rate. Charbonnet out (ACL).
SEA: Charbonnet (ACL) OUT, Tariq Woolen (hamstring) questionable. NE: Healthy.

keyMatchups: Drake Maye vs Seattle pressure (4th-best pressure rate in NFL)
Rhamondre Stevenson vs SEA run D (3.7 YPC allowed, best in NFL)
JSN vs NE secondary - game's most dangerous weapon
Hunter Henry vs SEA TE coverage (5th-most TE catches allowed)
Kenneth Walker vs NE run D (held LAC to 2.5 YPC)
NE pass rush vs Sam Darnold under pressure

news.text: Super Bowl LX set: Seattle Seahawks vs New England Patriots at Caesars Superdome
Seattle wins NFC Championship 27-24 over Rams - JSN 9/142/1
New England wins AFC Championship 24-17 over Broncos - Maye outduels Stidham
Patriots seeking 7th Super Bowl title, Seahawks seeking 2nd

pressure.note: Both QBs perform best in clean pocket - expect heavy blitz packages from both defenses

tprr_matchups.note: Elite route runner, NE must bracket
Receiving back role expanded in playoffs

insights: Both teams top-10 in defensive efficiency - expect under to hit
SEA plays MOFO 41% (top 5) - Maye must attack middle of field
NE plays varied coverages - Darnold will face multiple looks
Dome environment favors passing but both teams run-first
Coin flip game per analytics - home crowd slight edge to SEA designation

sgps.name: Defensive Slugfest
sgps.rationale: Both elite defenses, run game focus

sgps.name: JSN Super Bowl MVP
sgps.rationale: JSN has been unstoppable in playoffs

sgps.name: Maye Magic
sgps.rationale: Maye dual-threat exploits SEA's aggressive D
